summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of multiple minor victims between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor victims, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to these victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners and closest associates who conspired to entice and transport minors for sexual abuse.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the time period of the conspiracy.
Maxwell met, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, who was approximately 14 years old, and facilitated her travel for abuse.
Maxwell interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions knowing Epstein would sexually abuse her.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 on multiple occasions in New York and Florida, with Maxwell's facilitation.
Epstein invited Minor Victim-2 to New Mexico for the purpose of grooming and sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 on multiple occasions, including during massages arranged by Maxwell.

events.title: Conspiracy to Entice and Transport Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, facilitating their travel across state and international lines.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein befriended, groomed, and sexually abused Minor Victim-1 from age 14, including group sexual encounters and travel between Florida and New York.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein interacted with Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, with Maxwell providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged massages during which Epstein sexually abused her.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony (First)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony (Second)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely denied awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, denied knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and denied ever giving anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) between approximately 1994 and 1997.
Maxwell is accused of normalizing sexual abuse for victims by discussing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, being present during abuse, and participating in group sexual encounters.
The abuse occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London, England.

Maxwell committed perjury during 2016 depositions by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, denying awareness of sex toys, denying knowledge of Epstein's sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving massages.
